Authors:
Fernando Omar Zuloaga, Osvaldo Morrone, María Amalia
Scataglini
Title:
Revision of Trichiochlaena, A New Genus Segregated from
Panicum (Paniceae, Poaceae) Based on Morphological and Molecular
Data
Keywords:
Trichiochlaena, Gramineae, Grasses Panicum, phylogeny,
taxonomy.
Abstract:
Taxonomic features of species of Panicum, previously
classified in section Parvifolia and Verruculosa, are reviewed and
compared with those of other taxa in the Paniceae. The new genus
Trichiochlaena is proposed on the basis of shared morphological
characters, such as plants with membranous ligules, inflorescences lax
and open, spikelets ellipsoid to obovoid, pilose or glabrous, lower
glume ½ to 1/1 the spikelet length, and upper anthecium indurate with
bicellular microhairs and simple papillae all over its surface. These
morphological characteristics were confirmed with molecular phylogenetic
studies, analyzing chloroplast ndhF and rpoA sequences. As a result, a
total of 38 American and African species are considered within the genus
Trichiochlaena, and therefore a total of 38 new combinations are
proposed. The new genus is compared with other genera of the Paniceae.
Lectotypes are designated for Isachne trochainii A. Camus, Panicum
carannasense Mez, P. cyanescens var. rigidiusculum Döll, Panicum
frederici Rendle, P. helobium Mez ex Henrard, P. ianthum Stapf, P.
natalense Hochst., P. pubiglume Stapf, P. stenocladium Trin., and P.
schwackeanum Mez.
